content.value: In the first episode of Worth Your SALT, we sat down with Shira Frank to hear her thoughts on the intersection of humanity and technology. She shared some ways people in the industry could humanize blockchain and start to shift social problems.

Shira brings over 15 years of work in politics, social change, women’s philanthropy, and fundraising with her to the Blockchain and Fin-Tech industries. Shira spent seven years as a Deputy Director for J Street—the single-largest pro-Israel PAC in the US—working to transform the way Congress and the Executive branch engage in the Middle East and to promote the creation of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. During Shira's tenure, J Street partnered with the Obama Administration to successfully push the Iran-Nuclear deal through Congress and prevent a war with Iran. Shira holds a degree in Government and Political Theory from Smith College. She hails from the Redwood Coast of Arcata, CA and after spending eight years in our nation’s capital, she recently found her heart back in the wild west where she is currently living in Boulder, CO.
"I don't even think we know all the ways in which the limitations of technology are impacting us."
We talked with Nadav Hollander about the history of the financial system and the current crypto-backed lending space. He discusses his vision for fintech organizations and hope for a better world.
Nadav Hollander is Founder and CEO of Dharma.io, a decentralized credit company.
"Fundamentally... we need to invent entirely new paradigms for user experiences."

In this episode of WYS, we discussed the idea of decentralized marketplaces with Washington Sanchez. He shared his thoughts on the intersection of freedom of commerce and freedom of speech and other places censorship-resistant technology could apply.
Co-founder and CRO of OB1.io, and core developer for  OpenBazaar a decentralised marketplace where you can buy or sell anything for cryptocurrency.
"I think decentralization for decentralization's sake is a huge error."
We sat down with Jeffrey Berwick to discuss the future of finance and how it could be guided. Listen to how crypto is changing the game and learn about the history and basic principles of anarchism.

Anarcho-Capitalist.  Libertarian.  Freedom fighter against mankind’s two biggest enemies, the State and the Central Banks.  Jeff Berwick is the founder of The Dollar Vigilante and host of the popular video podcast, Anarchast.  Jeff is a prominent speaker at many of the world’s freedom, investment and cryptocurrency conferences including his own, Anarchapulco, as well as regularly in the media including CNBC, Bloomberg and Fox Business.  Jeff also posts exclusive content daily to the new blockchain based social media network, Steemit.
"I think that if enough people understood what's really going on, I think a lot of people would walk away from 'the system'."
